title: How to Make Chocolate Eclair Bars

steps.headline: Set out a small square plastic container, such as a clean ice cream container.
steps.description: Scoop out the chocolate ice cream and flatten it into the base of the container using the back of a spoon. Spread it across evenly.

steps.headline: Crumble the cake using your hands.
steps.description: Spread the crumbled cake over the chocolate ice cream.

steps.headline: Press the spoon firmly down onto the cake mixture.
steps.description: There should be next to no space for air left.

steps.headline: Scoop out the vanilla ice cream.
steps.description: Spread this over the pressed-down crumb layer.

steps.headline: Push craft sticks down into the layered ingredients, to make distinct bars (measure evenly across the container).
steps.description: Cover the whole lot with foil.

steps.headline: Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Let it freeze for 2 to 3 hours.

steps.headline: Take the frozen éclair bar mix out from the freezer.
steps.description: Cut the éclair bars out, following the craft stick markers, using a bread knife. Ensure that you cut them out evenly, so that there are no arguments about someone getting more than someone else!

steps.headline: Serve the éclair bars frozen.
steps.description: Any that are not chosen to be eaten must be returned to the freezer immediately to remain frozen solid.

text: Set out a small square plastic container, such as a clean ice cream container. Scoop out the chocolate ice cream and flatten it into the base of the container using the back of a spoon. Spread it across evenly. Crumble the cake using your hands. Spread the crumbled cake over the chocolate ice cream. Press the spoon firmly down onto the cake mixture. There should be next to no space for air left. Scoop out the vanilla ice cream. Spread this over the pressed-down crumb layer. Push craft sticks down into the layered ingredients, to make distinct bars (measure evenly across the container). Cover the whole lot with foil. Place in the freezer. Let it freeze for 2 to 3 hours. Take the frozen éclair bar mix out from the freezer. Cut the éclair bars out, following the craft stick markers, using a bread knife. Ensure that you cut them out evenly, so that there are no arguments about someone getting more than someone else! Serve the éclair bars frozen. Any that are not chosen to be eaten must be returned to the freezer immediately to remain frozen solid.
